definition: alarm bell
to alert/to warn/police
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
surname Zhong

sentences.english: The clock tower affair has set the alarm bells ringing.
sentences.chinese: 今次天星钟楼事件，为港府吸纳民意的机制敲响警钟。

sentences.english: When such complaints arise in France's most sensitive industry -- nuclear power -- alarm bells start ringing.
sentences.chinese: 当法国最敏感的核能产业怨声四起时，警钟已经敲响。

sentences.english: Of this case adjudge also ring noisy alarm bell again to fictitious belongings malfeasant .
sentences.chinese: 此案的宣判也给虚拟财产犯罪者再次敲响警钟。

sentences.english: It's when he damns you with faint abrasion that the alarm bells should ring.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是他准备责备你之前的警钟。

sentences.english: A warning voice admonished him not to be let this happen.
sentences.chinese: 他耳边响起警钟，告诫他别让这种事情发生。

sentences.english: She hopes the pet-food affair will be a wake-up call for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 她希望宠物食品事件能鸣起人们心中的警钟。

sentences.english: The phenomenon portrayed in the drawing is really thought- provoking and alarming.
sentences.chinese: 这一现象描绘的事情真的要引人深思并敲响警钟。

sentences.english: But by the time he sounded the alarm, it may have been too late.
sentences.chinese: 但他脑子里敲响警钟的那一刻或许已经太迟。

sentences.english: Austria's avalanche warning system raised the alarm to the second- highest grade.
sentences.chinese: 奥地利的雪崩警告制度提出了警钟到第二档次最高。

sentences.english: Tiny bibliophilic bells rang in the back of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 藏书家的小小警钟在他脑海鸣响。

sentences.english: It should have set off an alarm bell, but it didn’t.
sentences.chinese: 他的画本来应该为我敲响警钟，但是我却没有意识到。

sentences.english: We should keep the bell ringing in our mind.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该保持脑中警钟长鸣。

sentences.english: Grain security to be alarm bells ringing.
Do not forget to always fire alarm bells ringing, cherish life when the mind is awake.
sentences.chinese: 勿忘防火须时时警钟长鸣，珍惜生命当头脑清醒。

sentences.english: Such alarming reports have not slowed the huge expansion of the industry.
sentences.chinese: 这种警钟并没有减缓抗衰老业的神速发展。

definition: to be alert
to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
to warn/to alert/warning/cautionary
knell
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
to think of danger in times of safety/to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to realize suddenly/to wake up to the truth/to suddenly awake from sleep
don't forget past events, they can guide you in future (idiom); benefit from past experience
pinyin: qian2 shi4 bu4 wang4 , hou4 shi4 zhi1 shi1

definition: ghost of one who died unjustly/departed spirit demanding vengeance for grievances
lit. the cart in front overturns, a warning to the following cart (idiom); fig. draw lesson from the failure of one's predecessor/learn from past mistake/once bitten twice shy
pinyin: qian2 che1 zhi1 fu4 , hou4 che1 zhi1 jian4

definition: butcher's knife/abattoir hatchet
lesson/moral/to chide sb/to lecture sb
tragedy/calamity/atrocity
to be shamed/to be humiliated
